intro: Brachystelma blepharanthera, commonly known as the Cape orchid, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bulbous stem and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
